question: 溶かす
sourceMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an <ja>う</ja> sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>melt</kanji> and this word means <vocabulary>to melt something</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>to melt</vocabulary>. You're doing the melting, and you know it because you are the <reading>cause</reading> (<ja>かす</ja>) of the melting.
sourceReadingMnemonic: The thing that you melted in this situation is your <reading>toe</reading> (<ja>と</ja>). Feel your toe getting melted away. Augghh it hurts.
